Marauder nodded as Lamia expressed her agreement. He turned back t=
o
the panel he stood in front of and began to program into it a series
of i=
nstructions.

"This should not involve a major alteration of your structure=

will be installing several skill sets that should involve your batt=
le
prowess as well as your tactical knowledge." he turned back to look at
h=
er, "We have had several . . . um . . additions that we can use."

He smile=
d as he turned back to the panel. As he worked a door opened
and Dirge walk=
ed through and he looked over at Lamia and then at
Marauder. "Sir, the Inse=
ctors have their orders and are preparing now
for the next stage in the pla=
n."

Maurader nodded and then glanced up at Dirge, "Good." he said as he
st=
raightened. "I have programmed several changes that will be made to
Lamia."=
 he said gesturing at the female that stood at his side.
"Prepare the refor=
matting chamber."

Dirge glanced at Lamia, his face curious and perhaps a b=
it annoyed. He
was about to day something, but a subtle shake of the head f=
rom
Marauder forestalled it. Instead he just turned back to Lamia.

"This w=
ay." Dirge said to Lamia as he gestured to another door that
slid open in t=
he wall. The interior of that room glowed slightly as
energies coursed thro=
ugh it. In the center of the room was a pod that
was laid back like a bed.
=

Dirge glanced back at Lamia, "Lay here." he said shortly, gesturing at
the=
 pod bed.
